desc.p: If not for the limit parameter, this method (called without any additional filtering arguments) would simply return the OX codes of all the geocaches in the database (in arbitrary order). Then, you might use these codes to download the actual data about these caches.
However, the power of this method comes with the filtering parameters. All of them are optional, but you surely want to use at least some of them!

opt.name: type
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of cache type codes. If given, the results will be limited to the given cache types. Valid cache type codes currently include:
Notice: If you want to include all cache types except selected ones, prepend your value with the "-" sign.

opt.name: status
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of status codes. Only caches matching any of the given statuses will included in the response. Possible status codes include:

opt.name: owner
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of user names. If given, the list of returned caches will be limited to those owned by the given users.
Notice: User ID and User Name are two different things.

opt.name: terrain
opt.p: A string "X-Y", where X and Y are integers between 1 and 5, and X <= Y. Only caches with terrain rating between these numbers (inclusive) will be returned.

opt.name: difficulty
opt.p: A string "X-Y", where X and Y are integers between 1 and 5, and X <= Y. Only caches with difficulty rating between these numbers (inclusive) will be returned.

opt.name: size
opt.p: A string "X-Y", where X and Y are integers between 1 and 5, and X <= Y. Only caches with size attribute between these numbers (inclusive) will be returned (1 - micro, 5 - very big).
Notice: If you use this parameter, all caches which do not have a container (like event or virtual caches) will be excluded from the results.

opt.name: rating
opt.p: A string "X-Y", where X and Y are integers between 1 and 5, and X <= Y. Only caches with an overall rating between these numbers (inclusive) will be returned (1 - poor, 5 - excellent).
Notice: If you use this parameter, all caches with less than 4 votes will be excluded from results.

ul.li: Integer N. If N given, the result will contain only those caches which have at least N recommendations.

Integer N with a percent sign appended (ex. "20%"). The result will contain only those caches which have at last N% ratio of recommendations/founds. Please note, that this is useful only with conjunction with min_founds parameter.

opt.name: min_founds
opt.p: Integer N. If N given, the result will contain only those caches which have been found at least N times.

opt.name: modified_since
opt.p: A datetime value in a format of "yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss". If given, the list of returned geocaches will be limited to those which were created or modified since that date.

opt.name: found_status
opt.p: Notice: This parameter may be used only for requests signed with an Access Token.
Should be one of the following:

ul.li: found_only - only caches found by the user will be returned,
unfound_only - only caches not found by the user will be returned,
either - all caches will be returned.

opt.name: exclude_my_own
opt.p: Notice: This parameter may be used only for requests signed with an Access Token.
Boolean. If set to true, caches which the user is an owner of will not be included in the result.

opt.name: limit
opt.p: Integer in range 1..1000. Maximum number of caches returned.

returns.p: A dictionary of the following structure:

ul.li: results - a list of OX codes (unordered),
more - boolean, true means that there were more results for your query, but they were not returned because of the limit parameter.
